features: 🚗★ 【24h Parking / ACC Mode Switch】" MODE -": will active your dashcam parking mode for 24h Surveillance and power will cut off if voltage drops below 11.6V; " MODE O": will active ACC mode which only supplier power when engine is on

🚗★【Universal Dash Cam OBD Hardwire Kit】This OBD dash cam hard wire power charging cable kit is a universal model for most car dash cameras, GPS, radar, and dash cams on the market (Please note that this unit DOES NOT work with EV Car/Electric Vehicle)

🚗★【Simple Plug-in Installation】This OBD dash cam hardwire cable is easy to install by plugging it into your car's OBD connector and making sure it can power on your dashcam, then hide the extra wire; unlike other complex hardwire kits, you need to deal with fusebox and battery electricity

🚗★【Low voltage protection】It has a smart low voltage protection system that will automatically shut off the power to your dash cam when the battery voltage drops to 11.6V or 23.2V, thus preventing it from draining the battery

🚗★【Clean and Space Saving】 By using this dash cam OBD hardwire kit you can easily hide the wire and cable to make your carpet look wire-free and clean; also this dash cam charger doesn't occupy your car's cigarette lighter port and allow you can use the port to charge other devices in your car.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Winscon OBD Dashcam Hardwire kit OBD DASH CAM HARDWIRE KIT TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS: ACC mode Input: 12V-24V | Output: 5V/3ASurveillance mode Input: 12V-24V | Output: 5V/3ALength: 3.5meters(11.5 ft.)Interface: USB Type C

COMPATIBILITY: Please note that this unit does not work with EV Car(Electric Vehicle). The OBD dashcam hardwire charger cable is suitable for most vehicles' OBD ports. (If the OBD hardwire kit does not provide power, please feel free to ask us questions at any time). The OBD charger cable is design for majority dash cam, GPS, radar detection and other electronic devices with USB Type-c connector

Battery Protection The dash cam hardwire kit will cut off the power when the battery voltage gets too low. PLUG AND GO Plug into the car's OBD slot.Connect to the dashcam.Test the power supply and parking mode function.Hide the extra wires. PARKING MODE / ACC MODE You can choose different modes by a simple switch based on your parking environment.We do recommend using the ACC mode for long-time parking.

PRESS SWITCH TO SELECT 2 MODES: Mode “O”: ACC mode: When your car ACC is off, the OBD power cable will also power off after 20 minutes. Mode “—”: Surveillance mode: When your car ACC is off, the OBD power cable will keep working until detecting the car battery voltage is at 11.6V(low voltage), it will power off after 20 minutes. (Because the power of each car changes differently, some errors in the power failure time are normal) The low voltage protection for mode “—” protects your car from running out of the battery, and enables you to have enough voltage to start the car for the next driving.
PACKAGE INCLUDED: OBD dashcam hardwire kit (USB Type-C)*1 user manual*1 Adhesive Cable Organizers *4Opening Tool Bar *1

OBD Charger Cable Type C Hardwire Kit Parking Monitor Kit Switch Hardwire Kit Mini USB Hardwire Kit ACC Mode ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Parking Mode ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Low Voltage Protection ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Motion Detection NO NO ✓ NO NO USB Type-C ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ NO OBD Connection ✓ NO NO NO NO Fuse Tap Connection NO ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for (...but didn't know it)
reviews.reviewText: I have been wanting to get a hardwire kit for my Vantrue N4 Pro dashcam for some time now, but have been dreading trying to access the fuse box on my Mercedes as they (purposefully) do not make it easy. So I've been holding off which means I've felt like I've only been getting half the use out of my dashcam. Without the ability to power the parking mode, the dashcam completely shuts down when the engine is turned off. Plus, I'm not terribly crazy about the plug permanently sticking out of the lighter port as it looks out of place and often pops-out with the normal motion of driving shutting the camera down.So when I saw this connector that was USB-C to OBD, I was absolutely thrilled.To be honest, I wasn't even aware that connecting to the OBD port was even an option, so this was a very nice surprise. Prior to running the cable, I plugged in both connectors with the car off just to make sure it would work. Happily, the camera powered right up with no problem. So working back from the original cable, I was able to simply push the new cable in as I removed the old - following the same path under the trim. The cable to this connector is a little thicker in diameter than the temporary cable, so getting it fitted around some of the curves was a little more difficult, but in all, I had the full cable run in about 20 minutes.I was a little concerned that the cable connects to the OBD head on the opposite side of which the cable had to be run, thinking this may leave a visible loop or slack since the cable was run from the right, but terminates on the left. Fortunately, in my case at least, the cable was just the right length to make the run, so there was no extra slack and the installation is rather clean.An added bonus - and a feature I didn't even know I wanted until I had it - is the toggle switch on the OBD connector allowing you to cut power to the camera when it is not needed. I love this feature as my car is often securely garaged for extended periods, so there is no need to run the camera and potentially drain the battery in these instances. This toggle switch is a great feature allowing me to enable the camera while I'm parked in public - or if I were to ever be pulled over - but disable it when garaged at home.Given how happy I am with this set-up, it is easy to say that I highly recommend this OBD cable and would go so far as to say that I think its an even better choice over the fuse box option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does what it's supposed to do, just doesn't work in my vehicle.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to power an Android Auto/Apple Carplay device in my Rivian and while it does work in that I am able to draw power from the OBD port, apparently, the port is always fully powered and I can't get the screen to turn off. I tried the switch on the back of the unit in both positions but it made no difference at all, the screen just wouldn't shut off. So, clearly this would be great functionality for powering a dash cam or something that needs power all of the time but doesn't draw that much power but it's not for my use case. It was super easy to install and I did like that it came with the few extras that it comes with. I'm just going to have to find another way to use it since it doesn't work the way I need it to in my vehicle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An awesome alternative to hard wiring or cigarette lighter socket.
reviews.reviewText: Looking to take your dash cam setup to the next level? Say hello to this Dash Cam OBD Hardwire Kit - your ticket to hassle-free, 24/7 surveillance on the road! Let me tell you why this little gadget is a game-changer for any vehicle owner.First off, let's talk versatility. This hardwire kit is compatible with a wide range of dash cams, GPS systems, radar detectors, and more. Plus, installation is a breeze. Simply plug it into your car's OBD connector, power up your dash cam, and voila! No fussing with fuse boxes or dealing with complicated wiring - it's as easy as plug and go.But convenience isn't the only thing this kit has going for it. It's also incredibly smart. With its 24h Parking/ACC Mode Switch, you can choose between continuous surveillance or power that only kicks in when your engine is on. And thanks to its low voltage protection system, you can rest easy knowing that your dash cam won't drain your battery. It automatically shuts off power when the voltage drops below a certain threshold, ensuring you always have enough juice to start your car.And let's not forget about aesthetics. By using this hardwire kit, you can say goodbye to messy wires cluttering up your car's interior. The sleek design allows you to hide the wires effortlessly, giving your vehicle a clean, wire-free look. Plus, since it plugs into your car's OBD slot, you won't have to sacrifice your cigarette lighter port for charging other devices.Whether you're concerned about security, convenience, or just want to tidy up your car's interior, this kit has you covered. So why wait? Upgrade your dash cam setup today and enjoy peace of mind on every drive. Trust me, once you go OBD, you'll never go back!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smart design at a fair price
reviews.reviewText: Currently this cable is less than $15 and I could not be happier. The whole thing feels well made for the cost and it works exactly as described. I am using it to power my dashcam as my car shuts off acc power when it is turned off and it works flawlessly to keep everything running. I also wanted to be able to still use my OBD port while not having to plug and unplug this cable so I paired this with an OBD splitter that allows 2 things to be plugged in at once so I can run a scan tool and this without putting added stress on my OBD port by plugging and unplugging over and over.I love that it has voltage monitoring and the switch to go between ACC and Constant. That way, if I'm parked in the city I can leave the dashcam running but if I have the car at home in the driveway, I don't need to leave it running and it isn't a hassle to quickly change what I want it to do.Overall a great cable and a great price.
